alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Kennebec and east central Androscoggin Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Manchester to 6 miles south of Turner. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Augusta, Gardiner, Turner, China, Litchfield, Belgrade, Farmingdale, Manchester, Hallowell, Winthrop, Greene, Bowdoin, Chelsea, Leeds, Wales, Randolph, Monmouth and Sidney. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 49 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 89 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Cobbosseecontee Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
